item.title: Wildkeepers Rising launches March 31
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/02/wildkeepers-rising-launches-march-31

  • PC

Steam Next Fest: February 2025 Edition demo now available.

Survivor-like roguelite action game Wildkeepers Rising will launch for PC via Steam on March 31, developer Lioncode Games announced. A demo is available now as part of Steam Next Fest: February 2025 Edition.

Here is an overview of the game, via Lioncode Games:

About

Wildkeepers Rising is an action roguelite blending the power curve of a bullet heaven with the compulsive fun of a creature collector. Tame outlandish Guardians and savage dastardly hordes of monsters infesting the land. With art inspired by classic fantasy and anime, this hand-drawn indie offers a satisfying game loop with varied maps and modes to explore!

Story

The Guardians are powerful creatures from the spirit realm, and only Wildkeepers, special people with a deep connection to nature, can communicate with them. These days, few remember them. After winning the war with the help of the Guardians, the Wildkeepers were forgotten and the world moved on.

Many years later, monstrous hordes are suddenly attacking all over the world, and the Guardians are nowhere to be found. What happened to them? Who is responsible for the attacks? Will the Wildkeepers rise again, free the Guardians, and save the world?

Key Features

  • Vampire Survivors Meets Pokemon – Blends the ever-growing power curve of a Bullet Heaven with the compulsive fun of a creature collector. While the Guardians attack automatically, alongside your Wildkeeper, they also have powerful specials you can trigger with the push of a button.
  • Satisfying Survivor-Like – Wield weapons and command monster buddies in a casual, yet endlessly satisfying survivor-like. Tame a team of whimsical Guardians and decimate an endless onslaught of enemies in this hand-drawn indie adventure inspired by fantasy and anime classics.
  • Hand-Drawn Art Inspired by Jim Henson and Akira Toriyama – Hand-drawn creatures brim with personality, featuring stylish designs inspired by the art of Studio Ghibli, The Dark Crystal, and Dragon Ball.

Watch a new trailer below.

Release Date Trailer

item.title: Visual novel x pachinko game Jump the Track announced for PC
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/02/visual-novel-x-pachinko-game-jump-the-track-announced-for-pc

Baladins developer Seed by Seed has announced Jump the Track, a short game that blends visual novel with pachinko, coming to PC via Steam in 2025.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

You’re Sam, a young dreamer struggling in the gig economy. However, tonight may change everything. In this absurd comedy, fight your inner battles, rally your forces, and get ready to overthrow the system!

You’re in Trouble, Save Your Life

Meet Sam, a slacker too ambitious for his own good, whose life suddenly takes an absurd turn into a hectic and dangerous adventure that defies all odds!

It’s a matter of life or death, can Sam find a way out?

Let the Ball Guide Your Way

Jump the Track is an explosive comedy that blends visual novel with pachinko.

Sam struggles with inner turmoil and conflicting emotions. You have the power to guide fate—roll the ball and see where the story takes you!

Embrace Your Emotions and Rise Up Against the Power

How the hell are we supposed to live our lives working multiple shitty jobs at once to make ends meet while a few can live in luxury? And they are the ones threatening us with violence? Nothing can go wrong, right?

On the journey to save his life, you’ll have to encourage Sam to make decisions. Will you stand up against the power or lay low to stay in your security zone?

Absurd, chaotic, yet deeply touching comedy.

FAQ

  • Players – This is a solo game.
  • Controllers – Playable with a mouse only or a gamepad.
  • Duration – This is a relatively short game; you can complete the main storyline in two to three hours. However, you may want to replay to explore different choices and discover endings and scenes you might have missed!
  • Difficulty – The game’s difficulty ranges from moderate to easy. You will not be penalized if you fail at the arcade board, and the story will continue. However, excelling will unlock new options, some of which are quite radical.
  • Pause, Time Pressure – Arcade board games are brief, and you can pause them at any time. There is no time pressure, so you can take your time between shots.
  • Language – Yes, there will be slurs.

Watch the announcement trailer below.

Announce Teaser Trailer

item.title: Type-NOISE: Shonen Shojo new demo launches February 24
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/02/type-noise-shonen-shojo-new-demo-launches-february-24

  • PC

Play the first two chapters of the game.

Dank Hearts will release a new demo for multi-ending escape adventure game Type-NOISE: Shonen Shojo for PC via Steam, featuring the game’s first two chapters of the game, on February 24 as part of Steam Next Fest: February 2024 Edition, the company announced.

During the first two chapters, players will be able to experience new puzzles and three exploration segments. “Players will be able to explore protagonist Zena’s arrival into eerie, unfamiliar territory, then face her fears as mental anguish turns into hazardous hallucinations,” reads the press release.

Here is an overview of the game, via Dank Hearts:

Six teens find themselves lost in Noise Scramble City, a mind-bending metropolis manifesting their past traumas as “Noise” — mystifying mirages in the physical realm. Explore the Tokyo-esque cityscape and solve puzzles to break the mental chains of this perplexing alternate reality.

Every brain-teasing struggle carries a clue to overcoming the next obstacle — maintain a sharp memory and draw upon past experiences to unlock the path forward.

Uncover the mysterious beginnings of Noise Scramble City by engaging with the Spectre, the town’s eccentric and enigmatic feline guide. Unravel the truth behind each teenager’s predicament: every puzzle solved reveals a potential path to freedom from this mental labyrinth.

Guide each protagonist as they confront manifestations of their troubled histories. Overcome Zena’s stubbornness, Itsuki’s jealousy, Honoka’s paranoia, Kaito’s self-doubt, Hiyori’s vanity, and Soto’s codependency to unearth the root of their struggles and break free from the labyrinthine city for good.

Type-NOISE: Shonen Shojo is due out for PC via Steam in 2025.

View a new set of screenshots at the gallery.

Screenshots

  • ❮
  • ❯
